intro: Calycomelia elliptica, commonly known as the narrow-leaf calycomelia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, narrow leaves and small, clustered white or yellow flowers. It typically grows in forest understories and is adapted to humid, shaded environments. Calycomelia elliptica is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
